alert.note: Alert for Union (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 04 at 12:09PM EST until March 12 at 2:00AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky...Indiana... Ohio River at J.T. Myers Dam affecting Union and Posey Counties. For the Ohio River...including Owensboro, Newburgh Dam, Evansville, Henderson, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, Shawneetown, Golconda, Smithland Dam, Paducah, Olmsted Lock and Dam, Cairo...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING TO SUNDAY, MARCH 12... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at J.T. Myers Dam. * WHEN...From Sunday evening to Sunday, March 12. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Saturday the stage was 31.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 39.5 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 39.6 feet on 03/19/2006. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
